args:
Ramiel and Mordecai cross paths in the city.
Mordecai and Nevin just miss each other.
Ramiel catches Ilia's eye. But after noting each
other's presence, crisis strikes when the young
runaway boy abandons the city for the snowy
mountain dark.
My thought was that our target would be\nin the mountains if not the city, but these\npeaks are completely uninhabitable.
I suppose they might be hidden behind\nsome manner of magical barrier, but if\nthat's the case, there's little I can do.
Sadly, I find myself at an impasse.\nProbably best to just meet back up\nwith Nevin for now.
(I can only hope he hasn't COMPLETELY\nbotched the job of babysitting that lad...)
(Yet it seems only yesterday that he was\nthe one in need of minding... Heh!\nThese humans do grow up so quickly.)
(They possessed far greater mana than any\nhuman—but what WERE they?)
...He's gone. It's safe to come out.
I don't know. But anyone who shouts at\na person out of the blue is automatically\nsuspicious in my books.
Ilia—er, ALIA told me to keep you safe,\nand I intend to do a good job of it.
You speak like a child given an errand\nfrom his mother.
You two aren't brother and sister, so what\nare you, then? Lovers, perhaps?
She's not my sister or lover.\nWe don't share blood, but we're family all\nthe same.
That's lovely. I suppose some families\nare just like that, aren't they?
Yes. She's the most important person\nin the world to me.
It looks like a present. How sad that\nsomeone dropped it here.
They're probably looking for it, so I'll ask\naround in the square up ahead.
Oh, nothing. Just taking a little stroll\ndown memory lane.
So Ramiel—the dragon who was with me\nbefore—is basically my father.

He's what you call a workaholic, so we
didn't see each other a whole lot. But one
Dragonyule, he promised that we'd spend
the entire holiday together.
I was still just a kid then, mind you.
But then our luck turned sour and he got\nsent off on some faraway job—so I figured\nthat was pretty much it for his promise.
I gave up and went to bed like always.\nBut that night...
When I woke up the next morning,\nhe was zonked out next to me.
He spent all night flying home at top speed\njust to grant my silly little wish.

Here's my father, the one who's always
cool and collected, covered in bruises
and dead freaking tired. It was hilarious!
I mean, who does that for someone?

Happy? I just about burst at the seams.
It showed me how much he really cared
about me—which is when I realized I
had to take care of him in return.
We ate all three meals together that day,\nand he even brought me a present.
You got anybody like that in your life,\nAlfie? Someone to spend Dragonyule with?
Cat got your tongue again, eh?
How come he's your dad if he's a dragon\nand you're human? I mean, you're not\neven related, right?
It takes more than blood to make\na family, kiddo.
Heck, the world's full of parents and kids\nwho aren't blood related. Me and him are\nspecial, but not THAT special.
What's got you so hung up on whether or\nnot we're related?
I made a full lap of the entire city\nand still didn't find squat.

(Of course, whoever holds the key to
perdition will be popular with all sorts
of factions, so they won't just run around
with a big sign advertising the fact.)
I've got more questions than answers\nabout this whole mess.
(Like why would Meene go to all this\ntrouble just to leave behind her writings?)
Huh? Waaaait, that's one of the angels\nfrom the Northern Church!
Looks like they've caught wind of the\nrumors about the key too.
...Any chance this strange mana you picked\nup on came from whoever is holding the\nkey to perdition?
I can't rule it out, though it's just as likely\nit came from some other entity entirely.
You think some monster snuck into town?\nUgh, what a pain. I just hope they don't\nmake extra work for us.
Well, without any more substantive leads\nto go on, our mission will likely end in—
Alfie is gone! We must find him!
Oh, are you serious?! It's the middle\nof the night—AND it's freezing!
All the more reason we must find him\nbefore something terrible happens.\n...Ah, look there! Footprints!
Crazy kid's headed for the mountains.\nC'mon, Ramiel!
Those mountains are home to fiends with\na worse bite than the cold, so stay sharp.
